Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor and Query Performance Insights to continuously monitor the performance of the PostgreSQL database. Identify slow queries and optimize them.
Regularly check for and apply security updates to the PostgreSQL database to ensure protection against vulnerabilities.
Schedule and verify regular backups of the PostgreSQL database using Azure Backup services. Ensure backups are stored securely and are recoverable.
Conduct failover tests to ensure high availability configurations are functioning correctly and can handle unexpected outages.
Review and audit database access logs to ensure compliance with security policies and detect unauthorized access attempts.
Regularly review and optimize database configurations, such as memory allocation, connection limits, and indexing strategies, to improve performance.
Review and update security policies, including firewall rules and virtual network configurations, to adapt to changes in the database environment.
Perform restoration tests using backup data to ensure the integrity and reliability of backups.
Analyze query execution plans to identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements for better database performance.
Keep documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, database configurations, and troubleshooting guides.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential database outages or security incidents.
Evaluate the database's performance against the SLA metrics provided by Azure. Address any deviations or issues.
Develop and execute plans for scaling or upgrading the PostgreSQL database to meet growing demands.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new PostgreSQL features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding database performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
